skillTree.localised_description: Initially desiring simply to join his brothers in death, Helman Ghorst now travels atop a Corpse Cart driven by his Undead kin.

effects.description: Mount: The Brothers Ghorst Corpse Cart

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Helman Ghorst knows what he should not, but knowing is not enough – he must utilise this denied knowledge.
What Helman Ghorst has lost, he will reclaim – no power of this world or beyond will stop him.

effects.description: Spell number of uses: +1 for "Awaken from the Grave"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Grave Guards
Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

effects.description: Effect range: +50% for "Master of the Dead"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

effects.description: Targeting range: +200% for "Awaken From the Grave" and "Awaken From the Grave Upgraded"
Spell number of uses: +2 for "Awaken from the Grave"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Grave Guards

skillTree.localised_description: From atop Ghorst's nightmarish chariot pulse waves of puissant energy, enervating the undead and excoriating the souls of the living.

effects.description: Effect range: +35% for "Vigour Mortis", "Unholy Lodestone" and "The Reliquary Corruption"

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.
A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ghorst traverses the forsaken realm as he did the roads of the Empire, as a groom, before the study of necromancy consumed his every waking moment.
Mastery of the dark arts has imbued Ghorst with preternatural strength, enabling him to easily hold his own in combat.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +12 for Zombies units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Over time, Ghorst's skin has toughened like that of a corpse, causing arrows and sword-blows that would normally kill a man to merely glance off.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Zombies units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Having survived the deadly Plague of Blue Roses, even after deliberately infecting himself, Ghorst can easily recover from lesser wounds and sicknesses.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: +100% for Zombies units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: By which those caught in Ghorst's Danse Macabre are hurled forward into the fray, becoming far more lethal whilst the spell lasts.

effects.description: Effect range: +50% for "Vanhel's Dance Macabre Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"

Passive ability: "The Ravenous Dead" for Zombies units
	(all armies)

Weapon strength: +50% for Zombies units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: "Come to my side, my Undead servants. Now, you are bound, irrevocably, to my will forever!"

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +7% chance for destroyed units to be restored after battle
The Dead Rise Again: +15% chance for destroyed units to be restored after battle
Recruit rank: +3 for Skeletal and Zombie units

skillTree.localised_description: "And I'll lead you all in the dance," said he - the relentless dance of the tireless Undead hordes.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
"I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "Arise my host, my Unliving minions - bring me victory!"

skillTree.localised_description: "Can you hear it… the call of the night? Time for its children to arise and swarm."

skillTree.localised_description: Such evil spirits are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord howls out into the night, and is answered by the baying of dark creatures.

skillTree.localised_description: Vampires summon forth the gruesome remains of the ancient dead to bolster the masses of lesser minions under their control.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Magic-user can take to the skies, defying gravity by metamorphosing into a bat.

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +5% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle
The Dead Rise Again: +10% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle
The Dead Rise Again: +15% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle

skillTree.localised_description: A powerful, vigorous Lord of Darkness will see the Children of the Night gather unto them.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The sun is no ally of the dead - a sky scorched black, or darkest night, will invigorate the Unliving.

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
W'soran's scions are masters at the art of Necromancy, to dabble in such will be a boon.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.

	(Lord's army)

factionEffects.localised_description: Following the death of his family from the Plague of Blue Roses, Helman Ghorst plunged himself into the study of the black arts, hoping to return his brothers to life.

items.colour_text: This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.
